name: Grandma's Pumpkin Oatmeal Cookies
author: anjelique
summary: This is a recipe I adapted from my grandmother. It is my favorite pumpkin cookie recipe. Plus it makes enough for a crowd!
ingredients: 2 sticks unsalted butter, at room temperature
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Line baking sheets with parchment paper
Combine sugar and butter in a large mixing bowl
Beat with an electric mixer until creamy
Add pumpkin, eggs, and vanilla extract
Mix flour, oats, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt in a separate bowl
Add dry ingredients to the pumpkin mixture; mix until evenly incorporated
Drop scoopfuls of cookie dough onto the prepared baking sheets
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are firm and bottoms are golden brown, about 12 minutes
